page.title: 06DARNFORD BROOK
page.content: On Tuesday June 11th we did some work on{Darnford Brook}while we were staying at{Lower Darnford Farm. We measured a ten metre stretch of stream putting a peg at every metre.We measured across 4m from every peg so that we had a 10 x 4m rectangle, with the stream inside.We measured the distance of each bank from our pegs and drew the shape of the banks in our books. Then we decided on a key and mapped areas of quiet water with a sandy bottom ,white water with a stony bottom, reeds, trees and other things. We measured the depth of the stream at each metre and we collected animals from different areas we found a {bullhead ,caddis fly larvae,mayfly {nymphs,}a{leech,}a{shrimp,}and a clump of{eggs.
